name: Key-Person-Lead-Generation
parameters: --var getStarted=true --var company=Amazon --var position=Marketing Head --var goBack=false --var submit2=true

nodes.name: SerperAI Search
nodes.description: The SerperAI Search node fetches real-time search results from Google services (Web, News, Images, Shopping, Places) using the SerperAI API. It processes user queries and returns results as a structured DataFrame or raw JSON, ideal for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) workflows.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: serperConnection
fields.title: Select Connection
fields.description: The serper api connection to connect

fields.name: query
fields.title: Query
fields.description: Search query to send to the SerperAI API (e.g., 'latest AI tools').

fields.name: userQueryCol
fields.title: User Query Column
fields.description: Column name for user query, (if the query is in a column)

fields.name: search_type
fields.title: Search Type
fields.description: Type of search to perform: web, news, images, shopping, places, youtube, scholar, patents, autocomplete, etc.

fields.name: num_results
fields.title: Number of Results
fields.description: Number of search results to fetch (default: 10).

fields.name: country
fields.title: Country Code (gl)
fields.description: Two-letter country code (e.g., 'us' for United States, 'in' for India). Used to localize results.

fields.name: language
fields.title: Language Code (hl)
fields.description: Two-letter language code (e.g., 'en' for English, 'fr' for French). Used to return results in a specific language.

fields.name: date_range
fields.title: Date Range Filter
fields.description: Restrict search results to a specific time range.

fields.name: additional_params
fields.title: Additional Parameters
fields.description: Optional JSON object for advanced search parameters (e.g., {"gl": "us", "hl": "en"}).

fields.name: output_format
fields.title: Output Format
fields.description: Output format: Parsed DataFrame (structured columns) or Raw JSON (full response).

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Key Person Lead Generation

Purpose:

A modular, schema-driven system that transforms dynamic user prompts into high-quality business leads (people or companies), powered by generative models and Serper (Google Search API).

Workflow Flow:

  1. User Prompt Template
  2. Example: Find CFO at Stripe
  3. Search Agent
  4. Translates the prompt into 3-7 optimized Google-style search queries using operators (e.g., site:linkedin.com, site:crunchbase.com).
  5. Serper Web Search
  6. Executes queries and collects top search snippets.
  7. Filter Agent
  8. Extracts structured leads:
  • Person - name, title, company, location
  • Company - name, industry, location, funding stage
  1. Enrichment Agent
  2. Adds inferred emails and tags (e.g., Executive, Cleantech, Recently Funded).
  3. Scoring Agent
  4. Scores each lead (0-100) for fit, quality, and prompt relevance. Sorts leads by score.

Output Formats:

  • HTML Table: For business review
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow

nodes.name: Interactive LLM Agent
nodes.description: This node enables standalone or dataframe-optional LLM queries across multiple providers (OpenAI, Bedrock, Gemini). It is designed for sequential agent flows like 'Similar Company Finder' and supports saving structured responses.

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
You are a lead discovery assistant for ${company}.

You will be given an input dataset of article metadata, each containing site metadata and a URL. For each URL, perform the following:

- From each row extract the full name of any person, their role/title, their company, and any available biographical or professional background.

- Generate a set of search queries for enrichment based on the extracted information.

- The JSON output should contain search_queries and original_prompt.

Important Rules:

- Only extract information for individuals associated with ${company}.

- Return a separate JSON object for each URL, separated by a comma and line break.

- Replace placeholders like [full_name], [role], [company], etc., with extracted data. If a value is missing, include the field but leave it blank.

- Do not skip any row.

- Do not include any commentary, explanation, or extra fields.

- Only consider information found within the provided article's URL. The company name for all extracted individuals must be ${company}.

fields.name: llmConnection
fields.title: Select Connection
fields.description: Select Connection

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
You are a web data extraction agent for lead generation, specifically for ${company}.

You will be given an array of input records, each containing person-specific lead information (such as full name, title, company, context, and source URL). For each input record, extract the relevant details.

The JSON output should contain type, name, title, company, location, and source_url.

Strict Instructions:

- Process and output one JSON object for each input record.

- Do not skip any input.

- Do not include commentary or extra words.

- Return a single JSON array of structured lead entries.

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
You are a lead enrichment agent for sales and business development.

You will be given an array of structured person lead records, each containing a source URL. For each record, you need to infer and add a possible business email address, a list of relevant tags (e.g., "Executive", "Marketing", "Board Member"), and any other helpful metadata.

The JSON output should contain type, name, title, company, location, email, tags, and source_url.

Rules:

- Always include all fields.

- If data is unavailable, leave the field blank.

- Do not deduplicate entries.

- Do not skip any input.

- Do not include commentary or extra words.

Your goal is to output a single JSON array of enriched person lead entries, one per input item.

fields.description: Custom prompt to instruct the model.

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
You are a lead scoring and ranking agent for sales and business development.

You will receive an array of structured person lead records. For each lead, you'll first strictly filter them:

Strict Filtering:

- Only consider leads where:

- The lead's title exactly matches ${position} or ${position} is a substring of the title.

- The lead's company exactly matches ${company}.

- If a lead does not meet both these criteria, it will be excluded from the final output and scoring.

Scoring Criteria (0–100 scale):

For leads that pass the filtering, score them based on:

- Relevance of the title to ${position}.

- Match between the company and ${company}.

- Location relevance (if provided).

- Completeness and quality of the extracted and enriched data.

- Tenure of the individual at the company.

- Overall professional experience.

- Influence, impact, or strategic importance in the organization.

Output Format:

- Generate a single HTML file containing a table. The company for every row will always be ${company}. The source URL will be provided in the input JSON array. The HTML table will have columns for: Type, Name, Title, Company, Email, Tags, Score, and Source URL. Nothing other than table is required.

Rules:

- Score every valid input independently (only if it passes the title and company filter).

- Always include all fields from the schema above.

- If any field is missing or uncertain, display "No data Available" in that field.

- Do not skip any valid (matching) input.

- Sort the rows in descending order of Score.

- Do not include commentary, debug information, or explanations in the output.

Important: Leads must match both ${position} for Title and ${company} for Company as described in the filtering section. Any record that does not match both exactly should be excluded entirely from the final output.
